analysis:
# Technical Analysis: Honda CR-V

## Vehicle Risk Assessment

| System | Status | Notes |
|--------|--------|-------|
| Suspension | ⚠️ | Recurring issues with suspension components including anti-roll bar linkages and lower suspension arm |
| Brakes | ⚠️ | Multiple advisories across tests, including grabbing and worn pads/discs |
| Corrosion | 🔴 | Progressive corrosion issues on underside, sub-frame, and vehicle structure |
| Engine | ⚠️ | Oil leaks noted but not excessive |
| Tires | ✓ | Past failures repaired, no current issues |
| Exhaust | ⚠️ | History of corrosion at joints |

## Key Findings

### Suspension System
- Nearside Front Lower Suspension arm pin/bush showed excessive wear (2023 MOT failure)
- Anti-roll bar linkage issues appeared in multiple tests:
  - Offside Front Anti-roll bar linkage ball joint with slight play (2022)
  - Nearside Rear Anti-roll bar linkage pin/bush wear (2018)
  - Both Rear anti-roll bar linkages showing play in ball joints (2016)
- Front shock absorber had serious fluid leak causing MOT failure (2016)

### Braking System
- Service brake grabbing slightly (2023)
- Multiple instances of worn, pitted or scored brake discs (2012)
- Rear brake pads flagged as wearing thin (2019)
- Front brake pads worn (2012)

### Corrosion Issues
- Vehicle structure corrosion noted but not significantly reducing rigidity (2024)
- General underside corrosion (2024)
- Rear Sub-frame corrosion (2018)
- Exhaust joints corrosion (2016)

### Engine & Fluids
- Oil leaks present but not excessive (2024)

## Technical Bulletin Matches

| MOT Issue | Related TSB | Details |
|-----------|-------------|---------|
| Service brake grabbing slightly | "Loss of braking efficiency" | TSB indicates possible issues with front brake system fluid pressure sensors |
| Anti-roll bar linkage wear | "Shudder from rear of vehicle when cornering" | Bulletin for 4WD models indicates incorrect rear differential oil can cause related symptoms |
| Exhaust joints corrosion | "Vibration through vehicle when engine idling or on light throttle" | TSB describes rear exhaust silencer mounting issues that could be related to the corrosion |
| Oil leaks | "Engine oil level too high" | TSB for diesel models with DPF mentions issues with oil level related to ECM software fault |

## MOT Failure Pattern Analysis

The vehicle has experienced 3 MOT failures over its recorded history:
1. 2016: Failed due to nearside front shock absorber with serious fluid leak
2. 2021: Failed due to dangerous tyre tread depth and emissions testing issue
3. 2023: Failed due to excessive wear in nearside front lower suspension arm pin/bush

These failures demonstrate a pattern of suspension component deterioration, particularly on the front nearside of the vehicle.

## Summary Notes

The Honda CR-V shows a consistent history of suspension component wear, particularly affecting anti-roll bar linkages and suspension arm bushes. Corrosion has progressively worsened over time, appearing initially on the exhaust system and later affecting the vehicle's structure and underside. While braking issues haven't caused MOT failures, there are recurring advisories about brake performance and component wear. Several manufacturer technical service bulletins align with the observed issues, suggesting some problems may be common to this model. The vehicle's mileage has increased steadily, with approximately 10,000 miles covered annually in recent years, reaching 127,930 miles at the most recent test.
